revised_title: Rutherford's Legacy and the Birth of Nuclear Physics
tldr: The Rutherford Memorial Lecture discusses the life and work of Ernest Rutherford, a pioneer in nuclear physics. Rutherford's groundbreaking experiments led to the discovery of the nuclear atom, the first artificially produced transmutation of an atomic nucleus, and the understanding of atomic energy. His work laid the foundation for modern nuclear physics and the development of particle accelerators.
